sentence.Network_en: The thing was not known to be litigious when purchased.
sentence.Network_cn: 那东西买来时大家都不知道它在法律上是有问题的.

sentence.Network_en: It is the litigious and apparently arbitrary culture of regulation and policy.
sentence.Network_cn: 最糟糕的是监管和政策方面争斗不休且独断专行的文化.

sentence.Network_en: We live in a litigious society.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们生活在一个爱打官司的社会中.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French litigieux or Latin litigiosus from litigium 'litigation', from lis, lit- 'lawsuit'

entry.def: Someone who is litigious often makes formal complaints about people to a civil court of law.

means.word_mean: 2. inclined or showing an inclination to dispute or disagree, even to engage in law suits;

sentences.sentence: "a style described as abrasive and contentious"

auth_sentence.content: There are two ways to react to stories of litigious plods.

auth_sentence.content: We are dealing with a very litigious public fueled by a glut of lawyers.

auth_sentence.content: This audacious counterattack aside, the general issue is an old story of our litigious republic.
